question: you want to connect clips on more than one track to move and copy the clips as a unit. How can you achieve this?
options: Select all clips and make a clip group with Clip > Group
Recalculate the waveform overview
Select File > Export clips as files
Make a bounce of all clips and import it back to another track
answer: Select all clips and make a clip group with Clip > Group

question: Besides being able to go into record while playback is happening, what is another benefit of the punch record modes?
options: You are conserving disk space.
Pro Tools is discretely recording all audio from the moment you hit play, even before you are actively recording.
The audio is higher quality in punch record mode than in loop record mode.
Pro Tools automatically auto-tunes incoming audio.
answer: Pro Tools is discretely recording all audio from the moment you hit play, even before you are actively recording.

question: Can you copy and paste volume automation from one track to another?
options: Yes, it is just like audio or MIDI.

answer: Yes, it is just like audio or MIDI.

question: What color-coding preference do you select to make the playlist regions shown below have different colors?
options: Select Track Type under Default Track Color Coding, and select Track Color under Default Clip Color Coding.
Keep Always Display Marker Colors selected.
Select None under Default Track Color Coding, and select Clip List Color under Default Clip Color Coding.
No special preference is necessary. Playlist view automatically color-codes a variety of colors to playlisted clips.
answer: No special preference is necessary. Playlist view automatically color-codes a variety of colors to playlisted clips.

question: What does Cut Time do in the Event > Time Operations menu?
options: It makes the end of the session timeline shorter.

answer: It removes a timeline selection across all tracks and closes the gap.

question: You used Save As to save your session to a location outside the session folder on a mobile hard drive. When you tried to open the session on a different computer, all the files were offline. Why did this happen?
options: You did not select the Add audio files box in the Save As dialog box.
Your mobile drive is corrupt.
The other computer needs to be updated to the latest version of Pro Tools.
Save As saves only the .ptx session file, and does not include or move the associated audio files folder.
answer: Save As saves only the .ptx session file, and does not include or move the associated audio files folder.

question: How can you edit the All group?

question: Does the Audio Volume track view selector on an instrument track have any effect on the MIDl events in the track?

answer: No, it is simply a control for the instrument playback volume.

question: In the image shown, what does 3.5 dB signify on the bass clip?
